comment: This professor's Capstone class is disorganized and unclear. Instructions are vague, delivered in brief bullet points, and lack important details. Students constantly have to ask for clarification, and the professor seems indifferent. Nothing is graded or given feedback until the end of the semester, leaving us no clue if we are doing this right.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: responsive to my emails, gave advice when needed.

Capstone is time consuming as expected. Prof. El-Itr lectures about what we needed to add to our capstone notebook, it was straight forward, but it was aimed more towards the general concentration. If in a different concentration you will need to reach out to a different profs for specifics. He will help you out as much as possible regardless.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This class was def difficult, but also I learned more in this one class than the rest of my college career combined. Attendance isn't graded but I highly recommend you never miss a class because you will be very behind. Make sure you pick a strong team for the group project or you will hate your life. group project & 4 tests but lowest is dropped
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Choose a productive group for the semester-long project or prepare to do all the work yourself. Tests are more complex than the simplified version of course content covered in lectures. If you strive to understand the lecture material THOROUGHLY, common sense will get you through the tests. Dont wait to study for exams - less than 30% get As
